titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frank J. Donner Papers on the House Committee on Un-American Activities TAM.456
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-10-19T14:23-0400

change.item: Edited by Bonnie Gordon to reflect updated administrative information and title

did.unittitle: Frank J. Donner Papers on the House Committee on Un-American Activities

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This collection contains the papers of Frank J. Donner (1911-1993), author of , an account of HUAC's abuse of power and its opposition.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.167.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The papers contain collected clippings, editorials, and reports on the hearings, hearing transcripts, related flyers and newsletters and correspondence with Donner.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain beginning in 2078. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Congress. House. Committee on Un-American Activities.
